Abstract: Recent advancements in electroporation technologies have significantly expanded their applications from laboratory research to clinical settings. Pulsed field ablation, transfection, gene therapy, and electrochemotherapy have shown promising results, enhancing treatment efficacy and reducing side effects. Microfluidic platforms have further refined these techniques, enabling precise control and scalability. This review highlights the latest developments, focusing on the integration of microfluidics and the clinical translation of electroporation-based therapies.
